autumn.util

Class DS

  • java.lang.Object
    • autumn.util.DS

  • public final class DS
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides static utility methods for working with data-structures.

      • map

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Object> map(java.lang.Iterable iterable,
                                   Functor function)
                                            throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method applies a functor to each element of an iterable and collects the results.
        Parameters:
        iterable - is the iterable that provides input for the functor.
        function - is the functor(Object) : Object that processes the input.
        Returns:
        a list containing the output of the functor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - in order to allow exceptions to propagate from the functor.

      • filter

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Object> filter(java.lang.Iterable iterable,
                                      Functor function)
                                               throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method selects the elements from an iterable for which a given functor returns true.
        Parameters:
        iterable - is the iterable that provides input for the functor.
        function - is the functor(Object) : boolean that selects the elements.
        Returns:
        a list containing the selected elements.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - in order to allow exceptions to propagate from the functor.

      • sorted

        public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable> java.util.List<T> sorted(java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable)
        This method creates a sorted list from an unsorted iterable.

        If an in-place sort is preferred, consider using method sort(List) in class java.util.Collections.

        Parameters:
        iterable - provides the elements for the new sorted list.
        Returns:
        a sorted list that contains the elements of the given input iterable.

      • sorted

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> sorted(java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable,
                           java.util.Comparator<T> comparator)
        This method creates a sorted list from an unsorted iterable.

        If an in-place sort is preferred, consider using method sort(List) in class java.util.Collections.

        Parameters:
        iterable - provides the elements for the new sorted list.
        comparator - is a function object that can compare elements of the iterable.
        Returns:
        a sorted list that contains the elements of the given input iterable.

      • reversed

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> reversed(java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable)
        This method creates a list that contains the elements from an iterable in reverse order.

        If an reverse operation is preferred, consider using method reverse(List) in class java.util.Collections.

        Parameters:
        iterable - provides the elements for the new list.
        Returns:
        a list that contains the elements of the given input iterable in reverse.

      • indexOf

        public static <T> int indexOf(java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable,
              T value)
        This method searches for a value in an iterable.

        The search is conducted in moving away from index zero.

        Parameters:
        iterable - is the iterable to search.
        value - is the value to search for,
        Returns:
        the index of the found value, or negative one, if the value was not found.

      • indexOf

        public static <T> int indexOf(java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable,
              T value,
              int skip)
        This method searches for a value in an iterable, but skips given number of occurrences.

        The search is conducted in moving away from index zero.

        Parameters:
        iterable - is the iterable to search.
        value - is the value to search for,
        skip - is the number of occurrences to skip.
        Returns:
        the index of the found value, or negative one, if the value was not found.

      • contains

        public static <T> boolean contains(java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable,
                   T value)
        This method determines whether an iterable contains a given value.
        Parameters:
        iterable - is the iterable to search.
        value - is the value to search for.
        Returns:
        true, iff the iterable contains the value.

      • containsAll

        public static <T> boolean containsAll(java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable,
                      java.lang.Iterable<T> set)
        This method determines whether an iterable contains every element of another iterable.
        Parameters:
        iterable - is the iterable that must contain every element of set.
        set - is the iterable whose elements must be in the other iterable.
        Returns:
        true, iff at least one element X in iterable equals an element Y in set, for all elements in set.

      • containsAny

        public static <T> boolean containsAny(java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable,
                      java.lang.Iterable<T> set)
        This method determines whether an iterable contains an element of another iterable.
        Parameters:
        iterable - is the iterable that must contain an element from set.
        set - is the iterable that shares at least one element with the other iterable.
        Returns:
        true, iff at least one element in set equals an element in iterable.
